results.title: International ice patrol
results.creator_credit: Henwar Rodakiewicz and Affiliated Film Producers
results.brief_description: Shows how the US Coast Guard, operating under international agreements, patrols the North Atlantic shipping lanes in search of icebergs, and issues warnings to ships. Illustrates through a portrayal of the cutter Mendota’s search for Iceberg No. 39 in June 1947.

results.title: Instructing the worker on the job
results.brief_description: A new female employee is told to do a job on the drill press; she is unable to do the job and is then shown how to do it; this does not have the desired effect and in distress she leaves the machine; the supervisor then takes more care over instructing the next young woman assigned to operate the machine, and she becomes a competent operator. Thus are the differences between telling, showing, and instructing demonstrated.

Thus are the differences between telling, showing, and instructing demonstrated.

results.title: Insects and their homes
results.brief_description: Insects homes are of many forms, exist in numerous places, and are made of many kinds of materials. We observe a variety of such homes, from the simple cocoon in which the moth develops to the complex ant colony, and we see the many ways in which such homes help their inhabitants to survive.

results.title: The Inheritance
results.brief_description: An authentic history of America from the view point of its working people, from the early 1900’s. Shows how the first unions sprang from bitter disillusionment and traces the history of the people against the background of World War 1, the Twenties, the Depression, the Roosevelt era, and the present day struggles for civil rights. Narrated by Robert Ryan.

results.title: The Ingot
results.creator_credit: John Durst, Frank A. Hoare, Film Producers Guild and Merton Park
results.brief_description: More than 97% of the steel produced in Britain is cast into ingots. The different methods of teeming molten steel into ingot moulds are shown in this film, which also illustrates with sectional diagrams the difference between the main types of ingot and explains the purpose for which each type is generally used.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Durst, Frank A. Hoare, Film Producers Guild and Merton Park

results.title: Infectious diseases and man-made defences
results.brief_description: Some of the causes of infectious diseases and how we use man-made defences to protect ourselves. How antitoxins, vaccines, antibiotics and synthetic drugs are produced and used to help active and passive immunity in the body.

results.title: The Industrial revolution: beginnings in the United States
results.creator_credit: Dennis Azzarella, Lee Kohns, John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Traces the explosive growth of the Inudstrial Revolution in the United States - beginning with a thread mill built in 1791, followed by the first modern factory in history. Explains how labor-saving machines, mass production techniques, rapid communication devices increased the standard of living and how the development of fast transportation made the whole continent a market place. Part of the Rise of Industrial America series.

results.title: The Industrial revolution
results.creator_credit: W. Hugh Baddeley and Hugh Baddeley Productions
results.brief_description: The story of the industrial developments that transformed the cottage industries of the eighteenth century into the power-driven factories of the nineteenth century. Describes development of the steam-engine, inventions in the textile industry and developments in communications and transport.
